newsitem.title: USA: Informix Corp faces shareholder suit.
newsitem.headline: Informix Corp faces shareholder suit.

text.p: A New York law firm, Abbey, Gardy & Squitieri, LLP, said Monday that it has filed suit against Informix Corp on behalf of shareholders who bought its stock from April 16, 1996 through March 31, 1997.

The complaint, which counsel is seeking to have certified as a class action, alleges that Informix, as a result of improperly recognizing revenue in violation of generally accepted accounting principles, reported inflated and deceptive earnings.

The company is facing at least three other shareholder suits, and its chief financial officer, Alan Henricks, quit in May when the company reported a $140.1 million loss for the first quarter, ended March 30.
A Informix spokeswoman was not immediately available for comment.
